text_no_emoji: "As members of Congress reflect on their pending decision, I urge them to set aside political considerations.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "As Americans, we should be proud of this achievement." —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "As Americans, we should be proud of this achievement." —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "Now we have before us a solution that prevents Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon without resorting to war." —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "Now we have before us a solution that prevents Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon without resorting to war." —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "President Kennedy warned Americans not to see conflict as inevitable. It is time to apply such wisdom.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "President Kennedy warned Americans not to see conflict as inevitable. It is time to apply such wisdom.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "I have repeatedly challenged anyone opposed to this deal to put forward a better, plausible alternative." —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "I have repeatedly challenged anyone opposed to this deal to put forward a better, plausible alternative." —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "When we carefully examine the arguments against this deal, none of them stand up to scrutiny.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "When we carefully examine the arguments against this deal, none of them stand up to scrutiny.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "If Iran violates this deal, we will have ample opportunity to respond." —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "If Iran violates this deal, we will have ample opportunity to respond." —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "Worry less about being labeled weak. Worry more about getting it right.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "Worry less about being labeled weak. Worry more about getting it right.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "How can we in good conscience justify war before we have tested a diplomatic agreement that achieves our objectives?" —President Obama
text_no_emoji: "How can we in good conscience justify war before we have tested a diplomatic agreement that achieves our objectives?" —President Obama

text: “The choice we face is ultimately between diplomacy or some sort of war.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: “The choice we face is ultimately between diplomacy or some sort of war.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: “Walk away from this agreement and you will get a better deal—for Iran.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: “Walk away from this agreement and you will get a better deal—for Iran.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: “Those who say we can walk away from this deal and maintain sanctions are selling a fantasy.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: “Those who say we can walk away from this deal and maintain sanctions are selling a fantasy.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "We will continue to have sanctions in place on Iran's support for terrorism and violation of human rights."—President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: "We will continue to have sanctions in place on Iran's support for terrorism and violation of human rights."—President Obama #IranDeal

text: “There is no scenario where sanctions relief turns Iran into the region's dominate power.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: “An argument against sanctions relief is effectively an argument against any diplomatic solution.” —President Obama #IranDeal
text_no_emoji: “An argument against sanctions relief is effectively an argument against any diplomatic solution.” —President Obama #IranDeal

text: "Without this deal, the scenarios that critics warn about happening in 15 years could happen six months from now." —President Obama
text_no_emoji: "Without this deal, the scenarios that critics warn about happening in 15 years could happen six months from now." —President Obama

text: "What was once proclaimed as a historic mistake is now held up as a success." —President Obama #IranDeal
